q: What does the === operator do in JavaScript?
answers: Compares two values for equality without type conversion
Assigns a value to a variable
Checks if two values are equal, converting types if necessary
Performs a strict comparison of two values and their types

q: What is the purpose of the useState hook in React?
answers: It is used for making API calls
It provides access to browser cookies
It allows functional components to manage state
It connects React components to a Redux store

q: What is the purpose of the setTimeout function in JavaScript?
answers: It creates a new thread for executing code
It delays the execution of a function by a specified time
It defines a CSS style timeout for animations
It sets a timeout for AJAX requests
